Ingredients.2: 1  butternut squash, halved lengthwise and seeded

Ingredients.3: 1 salt and ground black pepper to taste

Ingredients.7: 0.5 cup shredded carrot, or to taste

Ingredients.8: 0.5 teaspoon dried marjoram, or to taste

Ingredients.9: 0.5 teaspoon celery seed, or to taste

Ingredients.10: 2 pinches cayenne pepper, or to taste

Ingredients.12: 0.25 cup heavy whipping cream, or more to taste

Ingredients.13: 2 ounces cream cheese, or more to taste

Directions.1: Preheat the oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.

Directions.2: Rub olive oil on the cut-side of butternut squash halves; sprinkle each with salt and black pepper. Lay squash, cut-side down, on the prepared baking sheet.

Directions.3: Bake in the preheated oven until tender, about 1 hour. Scoop squash flesh into a bowl, mash well, and set aside.

Directions.4: Melt butter in a medium pot over medium heat. Cook and stir onion and garlic in melted butter until onion is slightly softened, 3 to 5 minutes. Add carrot; cook and stir until carrot and onion are tender, 5 to 10 minutes.

Directions.5: Stir mashed squash, marjoram, celery seed, cayenne pepper, salt, and black pepper into onion mixture; cook and stir until heated through, 5 to 10 minutes. Stir in chicken stock; bring mixture to a boil.

Directions.6: Gradually add cream and cream cheese to squash mixture; stir until cream cheese is melted and incorporated. Bring to a simmer and cook until flavors blend, about 30 minutes.
